So that guy in the red cape and briefs with the spectacular belt buckle is really JESUS? Well I'll be smacked! He seems very selective about using his super powers - what with him being crucified when he could have just melted the Romans with with his heat vision!
 
 I think you're mixed up. Jesus was the guy who "took one in the neck" to save my soul. (Too bad it didn't work!) Superman could save me from Satan, though. He'd beat the snot out of him with a bus or something. Of course he'd have to use something besides his heat vision! Old Beelzebub is used to that stuff. Wouldn't even tickle!

No, you're mixed up. You see, Superman is a fictional comic book character who was created by Jerry Siegel and Joe Schuster back in the 30s. Jesus is the true Messiah of humanity who in fact did save the World from Spiritual Darkness. He defeated death and even travelled in ways that defied the laws of physics after being crucified and presumed dead by His murderers. Jesus Christ is the real Superman. Any powers you attribute to the fictional character Superman, you can accurately attribute to Jesus and you wont find him wanting. 
 
 I'm a real fan of Superman, but I love, worship and trust my eternal life to Jesus Christ. With that said, I'm calling it a night and have no desire to help you continue to mock the Lord.

 Jesus, Superman and Batman are on the shore of the Red Sea. Jesus says "Check this out", and he "brings forth" a freaking tidal wave of... well... biblical proportions!  Holy Tsunami Batman, unless you had the Bat-plane on standby and called it in to rescue you remotely by dropping you a bat-line and swooping you out of there, then you are surely what I would call bat-toast. But since Superman has a respect for all human life, I can't believe he would allow Batman to be destroyed by this super wave. He would just pick his friend Bruce Wayne up and carry him to safety or he would use his heat vision and simply evaporate the wave.
 
 The reason why even Superman would lose to Jesus is because all Jesus would have to do to defeat Superman is speak him out of existence. He could snap His fingers and Superman would cease to exist in time and space. Or He could send him to the Phantom Zone in short order. But if Superman attacked Jesus with all of his superpowers, he couldn't touch Him because his punches would just go through Jesus if He took upon Himself His Immortal self which is immaterial and therefore untouchable.
 
 There is no contest between Jesus and Superman as Superman is, in the final analysis a created being and Jesus is the Creator of all that is. So any challenge that Jesus creates that gives Superman a chance to survive, is merely toying with him because he could just speak it and the game would be over for the Man of Steel. But since Superman is good in reality, and serves humanity as our favorite Super hero, Jesus would never kill such a good person. 
 
 Unless Superman tried to take the glory of God upon himself and demanded that the World worship him as God. That would make him Gods enemy and would warrant his utter and complete destruction for setting himself up as God and committing blasphemy in the process.

 Your inability to read any form of subtext or meaning disturbs me. 
 
 Batman was a tool to explain that fictional characters and their traits are not set in stone. That any fictionalized character can gain any ability if its creators (who are changing as well) want to.

But Bruce Wayne never held that against him because had he changed history, the unknown effect on the Space Time Continuum may have meant Bruce just worked for his father and Batman never would have become Gotham Cities Caped Crusader. Bruce's greatest tragedy in life was also the driving force behind his secret identity as a Crime Fighter.

 The Space Time Continuum and the "greater good"? Good thing Bruce Wayne automatically took that into consideration when his parents were gunned down right before his eyes and he realised Superboy could have stopped it! Might have been nice if someone actually asked the young Bruce and his parents a little bit before hand! The choices:
 
 A) Two slain parents and a tortured, pertually self-consuming life of vindictive, dangerous crime fighting... OR -
 
 B) Mom and Dad, apple pie, and a job with dear ol' Pa. 
 
 Your answer, Bruce? "I'll take "A", thanks, Superboy!

...Jesus proved his power of the spoken word by speaking all of creation into existence.

 Hang on. That was his DAD, wasn't it? My copy of the OT ("BC Comix" - Issue 1, Volume 1, "Genisis"), says "GOD created the heavens and the Earth...", not JESUS.
 
 Now, of course there are avid fans of the franchise who'll refer to the NT (AD Comix - "The Rollicking Adventures of the Lord Jesus Christ", Issue 10, Volume 30, written by John Disciple) where JC says "I and my father are one".
 
 These fans also like Issue 27, Volume 46, written by Matthew D' Syple. Jesus is hanging around at Calvary, after a misunderstanding wherein he asked some nice Roman folks to put him up for the night (I think - don't quote me on that).
 
 He says - "My God, why hast thou forsaken me?" A rhetorcal question perhaps, since John, Issue 10 Vol 30, would have it to mean that Jesus was talking to HIMSELF!
 
 It seems from this, that Jesus would have to ask his DAD to "speak Superman out of existence". That's no fair. Even then, BC Comix only says the Big G spake things IN - not out. He mostly sent armies, and locusts, and plagues (OH MY!).

 A) Two slain parents and a tortured, pertually self-consuming life of vindictive, dangerous crime fighting... OR -
 
 B) Mom and Dad, apple pie, and a job with dear ol' Pa. 
 
 Your answer, Bruce? "I'll take "A", thanks, Superboy!
 
 Way to go, Superdick! Man, that's all sorts of messed up right there!
 
 
 You make a good point if Bruce knew at the time his parents were killed that Superboy could have prevented it. But Bruce was around 10 when his Parents were killed and he didn't meet Superboy till he was in his late teens. By then the shock had worn off, dontya think? He was looking forward, not backward.
 
 
Hang on. That was his DAD, wasn't it? My copy of the OT ("BC Comix" - Issue 1, Volume 1, "Genisis"), says "GOD created the heavens and the Earth...", not JESUS.
 
 Now, of course there are avid fans of the franchise who'll refer to the NT (AD Comix - "The Rollicking Adventures of the Lord Jesus Christ", Issue 10, Volume 30, written by John Disciple) where JC says "I and my father are one".
 
 These fans also like Issue 27, Volume 46, written by Matthew D' Syple. Jesus is hanging around at Calvary, after a misunderstanding wherein he asked some nice Roman folks to put him up for the night (I think - don't quote me on that).
 
 He says - "My God, why hast thou forsaken me?" A rhetorcal question perhaps, since John, Issue 10 Vol 30, would have it to mean that Jesus was talking to HIMSELF!
 
 It seems from this, that Jesus would have to ask his DAD to "speak Superman out of existence". That's no fair. Even then, BC Comix only says the Big G spake things IN - not out. He mostly sent armies, and locusts, and plagues (OH MY!).

 
 And don't forget John 1:1-4 that say's:
 
 Jhn 1:1 
 IN the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
 Jhn 1:2 
 He was in the beginning with God.
 Jhn 1:3 
 All things were made through Him, and without Him nothing was made that was made.
 Jhn 1:4 
 In Him was life, and the life was the light of men.
 Verse 3 is what motivated me to give Jesus the Credit for speaking everything into existence as He is the referred to as Word of God
 
 Now whether God would actually speak someone out of existence is a good question. I mean, He hasn't done it to satan who is His arch enemy so it probably is a stretch to think that He would just speak Supy out of existence. But that doesn't mean the Phantom Zone is out of the question.

Hm. Maybe just a Superhero escort service. Superman for the nice girls. Batman is for the goth girls. Aquaman for the surfers, Spiderman for the gymnasts. Wolverine for the hussies.

 Batman for the goth girls! LOL - good one. But never mind the dating - what about the mattress mambo?
 Superman is buff and all - it's like..., pecks, lats, delts... GLUTES! "r-r-r-r-reeeoww"...., And you know he has to be keeping things tidy for the ladies - you know - downtown. Smooooth. 
 Technique? More powerful than a locomotive! So ask him to be gentle - or not!
 
 Jesus - one word - SWARTHY. Forget than Roman Catholic "ultra benevolent" white guy with a halo in the faux-gold picture frame, with the mouse brown hair and the gentle yet piercing eyes. We're talking Israeli here. Israeli carpenter. Thick black hair (everywhere) - eyes like mica.
 Of course, the outward appearance belies an inwardly gentle nature. Jesus is basically a hippy. Add to that the bronze-age personal hygiene, and you've probably got some barriers to overcome when he drops his funky desert robes in the boudiour. But once you get past the overpowering b.o., the lice, and the yellow to brown teeth with the accompanying breath with the lingering reminders of his most recent spicy middle-eastern lunch, then you'll experience a communion truly divine.
 It's like he just KNOWS what to do, and he's all about an Earth shattering climax! Jesus can indeed fill you with the Holy Spirit! In the name of the father? Oh yeah!! Who's your daddy?

...the Phantom Zone is (not) out of the question.

 
 Objection, your honour. Facts not in evidence.
 
 Let's look at what JC brings to the table for this matchup, straight from the Bible; the same way SM has to rely on his comics, movies, etc.
 
 We've got manipulating nature (calming the Sea of Galilee). That's probably enough to say he could whip up a storm, etc.
 We've got healing the sick. Not much good in a fight, unless you want to beat your opponent to within an inch of his life, heal him, and start all over again.
 We've got the loaves and fishes. Again, combat value negligible.
 We've got water to wine.
 We've got walking on water.
 
 What else? Wasn't there something about making pigs run off a cliff? That would be handy if it worked with Superman, but it would be more of an annoyance to him than cause him any actual harm.
 
 Come on, JC - time to THROW DOWN! Watcha got?

Batman for the goth girls! LOL - good one. But never mind the dating - what about the mattress mambo?
 

 
 Maybe I should have said "escort service" - (nudge nudge wink wink).

Wolverine for the hussies.
